qas.question: When did John make his first visit to Ireland?
How many knights accompanied John to Ireland?
How did John offend the local Irish rulers?

answers.text: making fun of their unfashionable long beards

context: In <a0_0>1185<a0_0/> John made his first visit to Ireland, accompanied by <a1_0>300<a1_0/> knights and a team of administrators. Henry had tried to have John officially proclaimed King of Ireland, but Pope Lucius III would not agree. John's first period of rule in Ireland was not a success. Ireland had only recently been conquered by Anglo-Norman forces, and tensions were still rife between Henry II, the new settlers and the existing inhabitants. John infamously offended the local Irish rulers by <a2_0>making fun of their unfashionable long beards<a2_0/>, failed to make allies amongst the Anglo-Norman settlers, began to lose ground militarily against the Irish and finally returned to England later in the year, blaming the viceroy, Hugh de Lacy, for the fiasco.
